paper_abstract: Given a family of k sets with cardinalities s(1), s(2) . . . . . s(k) and N = Sigma(k)(i=1) s(i), we show that the size of the partial order graph induced by the subset relation (called the subset graph) is 0 (Sigma(si <= B) 2(si) + N/lg N . Sigma(si>B) lg (s(i)/B)),(2) where B = lg (N/lg(2) N). This implies a simpler proof to the 0(N-2/lg(2) N) bound concluded in Pritchard (1999) [4]. (c) 2012 Published by Elsevier B.V.
paper_title: On the size of the subset partial order
